subject: AI
title: User Corrections
description: Letting users correct AI outputs and learning from those corrections.

hook.text: The AI classifies a ticket as 'billing.' The support agent changes it to 'technical.' That correction is gold â€” if you capture it.

buildup.text: User corrections are the highest-quality feedback signal. They tell you exactly where the AI was wrong and what the right answer should have been.

discovery.text: Make corrections easy: editable outputs, dropdown overrides, 'this is wrong' buttons, and inline editing. Every correction should be logged with the original AI output for comparison.

twist.text: Corrections are a free eval dataset. Aggregate them monthly: which types of errors are most common? Which inputs trigger the most corrections? This drives targeted improvement.

climax.text: The correction loop: AI generates â†’ user corrects â†’ correction logged â†’ patterns analysed â†’ prompts/models improved â†’ fewer corrections needed. This is how AI products get better.

punchline.text: Every correction is a lesson. Make it easy to teach your AI.

quiz.question: Why are user corrections valuable for AI improvement?
options: They tell you exactly where the AI was wrong and what the right answer is
They make the UI look better
They are not useful for improvement
